title: (Pwn2Own) Lexmark CX331adwe PostScript File Parsing Memory Corruption Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Lexmark CX331adwe printers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the parsing of PostScript data. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a memory corruption condition. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the pagemaker user.
addtionnal_details: Lexmark has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://www.lexmark.com/en_us/solutions/security/lexmark-security-advisories.html
timeline:
2023-11-09 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2024-01-31 - Coordinated public release of advisory
